snippet: While scores of people are arrested on marijuana charges every day in the city, the laws apparently don’t apply to middle-aged white guys.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column on inequality and unfairness in New York City marijuana laws; says that hundreds of thousands of people have been arrested on marijuana charges in New York City under Mayor Michael R Bloomberg, but that about 87 percent of those arrests have been of blacks and Latinos, most of them men and generally under the age of 25.
lead_paragraph: While scores of people are arrested on marijuana charges every day in the city, the laws apparently don’t apply to middle-aged white guys.

headline.main: A Marijuana Stash That Carried Little Risk
